alert.note: Alert for Bayamon; Catano; Guaynabo; Toa Baja (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 09 at 5:17AM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM AST THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Bayamon, Catano, Guaynabo and Toa Baja. * WHEN...Until 700 AM AST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 513 AM AST, Doppler radar indicated that heavy rains have ended, but light to moderate rains continue to affect the area. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Emergency managers have reported various roads affected by flood waters. For this reason, and considering ongoing excessive runoff, a Flood Advisory has replaced the Flash Flood Warning.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
